tweets.text:
While it is tempting to make some money by using your van & advertising for free on Facebook & elsewhere, picking up & disposing of rubbish is a controlled industry

Make sure your business is legal & check you have the right permit for your activities 

https://t.co/xROnWI1FA3 https://t.co/NJkmHJC46q

Before you ask anyone to take your waste away for you, check they have a Waste Carrier Licence on the @envagency register: https://t.co/zZpuFforBL
We all have a #DutyofCare for the waste we produce. Don't make it easy for #flytippers
#KeepKentClean #Flytipping https://t.co/2Djt1XBJlq

Snowy conditions for our hard working Field Teams to contend with again in #Yorkshire. Here refuelling an 8‚Äù High Volume Pump that is currently moving 305 Litres of water per second (2.5 hours to empty an Olympic size swimming poolüëçüèº) #TeamEA https://t.co/zD9T6doTOF

We are really looking forward to take part in the free ‚ùÑÔ∏è winter @dorsetprepared event, 17 & 18 Feb. We will be leading on the #flood session, but there's a lot more to get involved with. Make sure you book your space https://t.co/4KgiZ2pxLG @CommunitiesPrep https://t.co/fTcwg79AWw

We ran a workshop with @portsmouthuni for local groups looking at ideas on behaviour change on disposing of plastics.

Experts believe around 10 mill tonnes of plastic waste enters the ocean each year, which is equivalent to a bin lorry load every minute. https://t.co/Ge1UbZYHsX https://t.co/spDtstZVTH

tweets.text:
7 days to go‚Ä¶.

The countdown has now started to the start of construction of the 1st phase of the new ¬£76mil Flood Risk Management Scheme in #Kendal. 

When finished, the 3 phased scheme will protect 1480 homes and 1151 business from flooding.

More info https://t.co/F4fe5jNVEN https://t.co/57f1OoW86p

No need to miss out on the Farm Update North (supported by @NorthumbrianH2O)  event with guest speaker @DefraGovUK @JanetHughes (extensive Q&As) & presentations by supporting partners @Ruralpay @DefraFAS @EnvAgencyYNE @ForestryComm  View recording>>> https://t.co/ijnkOP3QO1 https://t.co/rsMfODTj1g

Much Wenlock Refresh Group has now completed its Regulation 19 submission for @ShropCouncil's Local Plan Review. A weighty document, but one that reflects the degree of concern about proposed housing development and demonstrates sustainable alternatives https://t.co/6hRKDJBiFQ https://t.co/GdeMCKNTqP

Alongside the countdown to start of @EnvAgencyNW flood scheme in Kendal I‚Äôm going to cover some of the environmental projects we have supported with #partners in the catchment including the River Gowan restoration https://t.co/QJgKuGufH3

An extra ¬£75m/year is needed to maintain rivers and reduce #flooding across rural England, according to the @CLAtweets.

https://t.co/nvbhOtS3tf

#farminguk

tweets.text:
Never drive through flood water. 

It's the number one cause of death during floods and even relatively shallow water can move your car or wreck its engine.

https://t.co/vhT6xEotas https://t.co/EGhXllzz90
As well as being Trustees for @slowtheflow_UK @adrianandkim and @mrsk3r moonlight as #mytholmroydfloodwardens.  Never a dull moment!! @Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/dbrcMVo78z
@KathrynMackenz6 @AffinityWater @OliverHealdUK This is a nostalgic blast from the past. How the river used to be. @AffinityWater @EnvAgency this is what we want all year round. @AquiferChalk

One year on from the floods of #StormCiara, take a look at this video from @Calderdale to see the work that has been done to reduce #flood risk and how partners and the community are working together to be better prepared and resilient to flooding #floodaware https://t.co/4tS3MsWaNt

domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

domain.description: Television show episodes

tweets.text: There is water in the upper Ivel!.....& so there should be with rainfall Jul-Dec ‚Äò20 +60% above aver for this period. C‚Äômon ‚Å¶@AffinityWater‚Å© - Cut the abstraction rate so that people & wildlife can enjoy the river all yr round. ‚Å¶@OliverHealdUK‚Å© ‚Å¶@IvelRev‚Å© üö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüêüüêõ https://t.co/pkLpI3WbGI

Yesterday the @EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeam undertook a proactive (but precautionary) temporary defence deployment.

The barrier is from @HESCOGroup is essentially interlocked heavy duty bags that we fill with stone/soil/sand & has a waterproof membrane - a rapidly deployable option. https://t.co/bjKEAIf9LY

Meanwhile we wait for regional summit that didn‚Äôt happen @DefraGovUK & our brilliant partners, wardens & media do their best to build #resilience & support in our weary place  @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater @slowtheflow_UK @CalderdaleFound @yorkshirepost @JayMitchinson üíöüíöüíö 3/3 https://t.co/nwFqpauPxN

tweets.text: I haven‚Äôt posted for a while, but great to see some of the attenuation areas holding water after all the rain! #nfm #slowtheflow #watermanagement #upstreamstorage @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @isbournecatch @GlosCC @TewkesburyBCgov https://t.co/2dyfAR5hMl

We lowered the Hull Tidal Surge Barrier this morning at low tide to help reduce water levels in the #River #Hull. When lowered the 212 tonne steel gate prevents tidal water entering the River Hull, creating additional space to drain water from rivers that flow into the river Hull https://t.co/kZV5Egolky

SOMETHING FOR THE WEEKEND SIR.

This is a short tale about 2 environment regulators, yes we do have 2, but don't panic it's also a tale about how someone, somewhere appears to have a lot of questions to answer.

Ladies & gentlemen meet the @EnvAgency (EA) & @NaturalEngland (NE) https://t.co/ymZ1HD4DRu

tweets.text:
U.K. Floods 

We are once again providing sand, sandbags & volunteers to assist the #Colnbrook community with floods defences! 

Over 40 tonnes of sand so far and over 1500 sandbags supplied in total 

@guardianeco @SloughCouncil @AdamAfriyie @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/i9zL5Mxs1P

We're back in action hosing down the riverside paths today. The clean-up was held up by the #flood level rising again last week. You should be able to safely walk and cycle again along #Worcester's beautiful riverside very soon. https://t.co/pEl2ACfGIl

domain.name: TV Shows

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

@EnvAgency talk to ESA and majors at senior level. Those organisations do not understand what is going on in the ponds where they do not fish. Unfortunately mid sized legitimate operators get no opportunity to share information or concerns. https://t.co/NrTGsQDoER

Thanks @portsmouthuni for working with the @EnvAgency #plastics team on this virtual workshop for the @Plastic_EU project. #behaviourchange is something we are all in control of. https://t.co/RlX3M4vafx
